intro: Taraxacum vestmannicum, commonly known as the Vestmann's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Azores. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and milky sap. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and rocky soils, thriving in mild, temperate climates. Its leaves are basal, toothed, and form a rosette, while its flowers are yellow and develop into parachute-like seeds. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and supporting soil stability.
